A new Ultimate hero will rise but nothing can stop the path of destruction as the Ultimate Enemy is revealed.

Followed by: Ultimate Doom.

Translated into Spanish.

deck: These comics were stand-alone stories featured in the two and three figure packs. They were published by Hasbro and were written by original Joe scribe, Larry Hama.
description:
A part of Hasbro 25th Anniversary 2 figure comic packs. Several issues were labelled issues because they took place directly in-between some of the Marvel G.I. Joe A Real American Hero issues that Larry Hama wrote in the 1980's. Other issues reference time or places that connect them to the Real American Hero continuity.

Issues 21 , 32 & 36 , although not labelled #1,#2, or #3, are considered the first three issues of this series. Issue #8 is considered to be part of the G.I. Joe: Resolute animated universe.
name: G.I. Joe:  A Real American Hero

description:
Hotwire is back. It's six months since the events of Requiem for the Dead and she hasn't been to work since. She has a new arm and the scars have faded but her connection to the dead still troubles her. What can get her out of the house and back in the saddle? Seeing a botched police take down of a Blue-light that causes mass mayhem and death Alice investigates adn finds that this blue-light is something special and whats more he has a hostage now.

Watch Alice uncover the truth behind this new kind of Blue-light and the woman he is trying to help.
name: Hotwire: Deep Cut

deck: Compilation of the Vector storyline
description:
Please note: This collection contains Knights of the Old Republic Volume 5 (KotOR issues #25-28) and Dark Times Volume 3 (DT issues #11-12)

"Vector," an event with repercussions for every era and every hero in the Star Wars galaxy begins here!

In Chapter One Knights of the Old Republic Volume Five, a terrible vision reaching far into the future alerts the secret Jedi Covenant to the importance of Taris. They activate operative Celeste Morne. She encounters a monstrous threat, an ancient Sith artifact, an army of Mandalorians, and Zayne Carrick, the Padawan accused of killing his fellow students!

Then, over 4,000 years into the future, Chapter Two of "Vector"--Volume Three of Dark Times--crosses into the period immediately following the events in Revenge of the Sith. The unfortunate misfit crew of the Uhumele is thrown into the path of Darth Vader and the now, ancient Jedi Master, Celeste! Both Sith and smugglers will not leave this meeting without grave consequences.

For anyone who never knew where to start with Star Wars comics, "Vector" is the perfect introduction to the entire Star Wars line!

* Collects Knights of the Old Republic #25-28 and Dark Times #11-12.
name: Star Wars: Vector

description: A trade paperback which reprints the issues of Incredible Hulk which crossed over into House of M.
name: House of M: Incredible Hulk

description: A trade paperback which reprints classic stories featuring Iron Man and Captain America teaming up.
name: Iron Man/Captain America

description:
English translation of the Japanese manga Rupan Sansei.

These humorously sordid tales found a very successful five year run in Weekly Manga Action before being picked up by Tokyopop in 2002. This marked the first time the series had been officially translated and released in America, almost thirty-five years since it's original run in Japan.

Lupin's incredible adventures continue in Lupin III: World's Most Wanted.
name: Lupin III

deck: A mini graphic novel that was free with the limited edition of Halo Wars
description: A prequel comic packaged with the collector's edition of Halo Wars.
name: Halo Wars Genesis

description:
Mid 1980s...

"The trick is to kill one's victim more than once. Many times. To make a man die over and over again in his own mind. That's how I want to see Moon Knight... standing there helpless and foolish and humiliated as his closest friends are gunned down before him."

Bushman's vow to destroy Moon Knight could echo around the globe. He's mesmerized the people Moon Knight cares about most, turning them into zombie-like assassins. Their target: the leaders of the world's super powers. Set in a time when global destruction was never more imminent, Bushman's scheme could push the planet to the nuclear brink. The lives of Moon Knight, his friends, and nine billion people hang in the balance.
name: Moon Knight: Divided We Fall
The Saga of Ra's Al Ghul

first_issue.name: "In To The Den of the Death-Dealers!

description: Forces In Combat was a British weekly comic first released in 1980. The series was an attempt by Marvel UK to produce a comic more in line with the traditional British boy`s weekly. It reprinted earlier Marvel stories in short chapters and ran for 37 issues. Some of the comic-strips featured included Master Of Kung-Fu, Rom:Spaceknight, The Rawhide Kid, Kull The Conqueror, Machine Man, the Golem, the John Kowalski War is Hell stories and Sergeant Fury, plus colour reprints of Ron Embleton's Wulf the Briton, a non-Marvel strip that originally appeared in Express Weekly. After 37 issues it merged with Future Tense to become Future Tense and Forces in Combat; the first combined issue was #13, continuing Future Tense's numbering. Rom was the only strip to transfer over to the new title. The Forces in Combat subtitle was unceremoniously dropped from Future Tense only one week later, as the cover title reverted to simply Future Tense as of #14.
name: Forces In Combat

description:
The Legend of the Steel Breed is the Brain Child of Marvin S. Mariano. In late 2009 Marvin along with long time friend James Bade decided it was time to create an original comic book. The Legend of the Steel Breed debuted online as a black and white webcomic on September 9th 2009 following a single page release schedule. The final page of issue #1 was released on January 15th 2010, this was followed up by a full colour printed edition which was debuted at Wizard World Toronto .

Issue 2 and on will be released in the same manner, online as a Black and white webcomic followed up with a full color print edition. Issue 2 is slated for a special release edition at FanExpo Canada on August 27th 2010.
name: The Legend of the Steel Breed

description:
A virus that turns humanity into cannibals is released into the world. One of the few unaffected humans is Frank Castle and it's his job to kill all of the infected humans and superheroes and villains. Frank Castle is immune to the virus due to how the toxin was released, partly his fault, so he needs to atone for releasing the toxin by killing everyone that's infected and saving the last few remaining unaffected humans.

This series was followed by the prequel Marvel Universe vs. Wolverine exploring the source of the infection and the third volume taking place between the two entitled Marvel Universe vs. The Avengers.

Collected Editions

  • Marvel Universe vs. The Punisher
  • Punisher vs. the Marvel Universe

Translated into Spanish.
name: Marvel Universe vs. The Punisher
